Text: LaserDisc:  Although the format was capable of offering higher-quality video and audio than its consumer rivals, VHS and Betamax videotape, LaserDisc never managed to gain widespread use in North America, largely due to high costs for the players and video titles themselves and the inability to record TV programs.

Text: LaserDisc:  It was not a popular format in Europe and Australia when first released but eventually did gain traction in these regions to become popular in the 1990s.
